Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Christie Leonard
Reviews.Content: Before item was shipped, seller sent email stating that I had purchased one unit and they are useful only in pairs.  I assume this was an invitation to double my investment. So eventually I did and had to pay the shipping again.When the item did arrive and was integrated into our system the color transfer across balun was disappointing. I have a balun setup which is powered (not passive) like this one and it yields better results.

Reviews.Title: The best solution for runs over 25 ft!
Reviews.Author: Ryan P. Cunningham
Reviews.Content: These are the best solution for any S-Video run over 25 ft. Cat5e cable is cheap and is easy to run and terminate.These have been installed in a system that require S-Video feeds from a camera. We used to run a dual mini coax cable and then terminate the two cables into one S-Video plug. That was a tedious and time consuming process. It required someone with a medium to high skill level in soldering. These systems are installed across the country with some installers being first-time volunteers. Now anyone can be taught how to terminate into an 8P8C ( RJ45 ). The cost of this adapter compared to bulk or pre-built S-Video cables is far outweighed by it's value in ease of installation and termination. Video quality over a long length (100-200 ft) is the same as a quality 25ft pre made cable.These are now a standard item in our purchasing requirements for our ASL Control system.
